TopicTitle: Need a heavy lifter that can lift 450 tons.

Articles.Content: O'k so I need a heavy lifter. I built a Armored starship only problem weighing In at 450 tons Its grounded I cant build any thing that will lift It so any of you have some Insane lifter? for Verizon 0.22?
Do you mean version 0.23? Because that came out a few days ago.
I struggle to get 30 tons into orbit and my lifter weighed around 280 tons so you are going to have to break out some cheats on this one. Or build it in orbit.

Do you mean version 0.23? Because that came out a few days ago.

You can still download the one previous version from the KSP Store even after an update. Also, some people probably haven't gotten around to manually updating their copies for whatever reason.
If you are trying to lift 450 tons you are going to need a massive lifter, or you can hack gravity with alt+f12.

O'k so I need a heavy lifter. I built a Armored starship only problem weighing In at 450 tons Its grounded I cant build any thing that will lift It so any of you have some Insane lifter? for Verizon 0.22?

Sweet Jeb-us, what are you lifting? A vault full of uranium?

-Duxwing

This ship puts a payload of 416 tons into Munar orbit. It'll probably lift 450 ton to into LKO, if not just add one more layer of staging.

You're on your own for figuring out how to adapt it to your specific needs, though. You may have to install Kerbal Engineer Redux to load it - and you should install it anyway because it makes building huge rockets like that much, MUCH easier.

Oh yeah, and it breaks easily. Keep an eye on the flight log (F3) for structural failures... 'cause if there's a structural failure you will not be going to space.

Edit: Ere... I built it in 0.22 but it was recently saved in 0.23. Dunno if editing the craft file to a different version number is sufficient. Sorry for not catching that part of your post. (You should seriously upgrade, though)

=Smidge=

Edited December 24, 2013 by Smidge204

My heavy lifter can only do 330t sorry. May be able to adapt it, it uses KW Rocketry mod though the engines are NOT the most powerful. (T1 Titans).
